intro: Cynoglossum luristanicum, commonly known as the Luristan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Iran. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate, often with a rough texture, and it blooms during the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
